turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: It ain't been a good day, Chief.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Give up, Dennis.  Let these people go. At least you'll have your life.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Who else is here?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: My father.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: He needs a doctor.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Shut up and sit down.  You think someone's gonna make a house call?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: My father needs a doctor.  <u>Please</u>.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Hey, I've got a situation here, in case you haven't noticed.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: All you're doing is watching yourself on TV.  <u>Look</u> at him.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Use more ice.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I'm getting a doctor!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: What about my father?

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Aw, Jesus, not more of this.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: <u>Look</u> at him!  I think he's dying!

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Take'm back upstairs, but don't tie'm like before.  That little fuck untied himself anyway.

turns.speaker: MARS
turns.text: It's a safety room.  If anyone breaks into your house, you can hide.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Who gives a shit, Mars?  Check out the cash!  We're rich.

turns.speaker: MARS
turns.text: We're trapped in a house.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: We can take it with us.

turns.speaker: MARS
turns.text: You can't run with suitcases.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: That's right.  That's a good idea, Mars.

turns.speaker: MARS
turns.text: Find something:  Extension cords, rope, wire--we'll have to tie them tight.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Find something, Kevin.  Don't just stand there.  And tie this bastard, too.  I don't want him waking up and goin' Rambo on us.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: The cops are comin'!

turns.speaker: MARS
turns.text: I got the gasoline --

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: We don't have time!

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: What the fuck is that?

turns.speaker: MARS
turns.text: They'll cut the power.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Cops want to be rich like everyone else. All we have to do is share.  And if he wants someone to swing for the Chinaman, we'll give'm Mars.

turns.speaker: MARS
turns.text: Dennis.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: You got something to say?

turns.speaker: MARS
turns.text: I like it here, Dennis.  I'm never going to leave.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Fuckin' A.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: You mean he <u>left</u>, as in went out the front door?

turns.speaker: MARS
turns.text: I overheard him with the girl.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: <u>Shit</u>!  That <u>fuck</u>!  Even when I want to turn myself in he screws it up!  Did he take the kids with him?

turns.speaker: MARS
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Jesus, get upstairs and find out!  If he took those kids, we're fucked!

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Can you identify this man?

turns.speaker: DILL
turns.text: That would be Mars Krupchek.  Jesus, he works for me, too.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Have Louise run the name 'Mars Krupchek' through DMV and NCIC.  Tell her to list the tattoo as an identifier.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Is Krupchek an aggressive guy?  Hot- tempered?  Anything like that?

turns.speaker: DILL
turns.text: Keeps to himself, more like.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: You have his address?

turns.speaker: DILL
turns.text: Pretty sure I do.  Yeah, here we go --

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: Talley lives here.  I don't know if the place has security or not.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: It won't be a problem.

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: He has a wife and kid.  That's how we'll get to him.

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: Okey-doke.

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: We have to own this guy, Marion.  We don't want him dead; we need to use him.

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: Donuts here any good?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: I don't eat junk food.

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: Are you out of your mind?

turns.speaker: MARION
turns.text: You fucked up, Glen.

turns.speaker: SEYMORE
turns.text: L.A. County Sheriffs are inbound from a bank robbery in Pico Rivera.

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: Give me an ETA.

turns.speaker: SEYMORE
turns.text: An hour, tops.  Might be sooner.

turns.speaker: SEYMORE
turns.text: What if it goes south?

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: SEYMORE
turns.text: If things get wet, we're going to need someone who can handle that end.

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: You worry about your end.  I got my side covered.

turns.speaker: SEYMORE
turns.text: I heard he's fucked up.  They're taking him to the hospital.

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: Goddamnit, tell me what you <u>know</u>.  Did the cops go in?  Did Smith have the disks?

turns.speaker: SEYMORE
turns.text: <u>I don't know</u>.  Talley talked those punks into letting Smith out.  He's fucking us over, Glen.  That guy is fucking us over.

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: What hospital?

turns.speaker: SEYMORE
turns.text: Canyon Country.

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: How did you get this number?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Mr. Jones is dead.  So are two of his men.  The other three are in jail.  I have the disks.  I have Walter Smith. And you know what, you motherfucker?  I have you.

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: I have your fucking family.  Don't forget that.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I also have a couple of million in cash. Call Sonny Benza.  Ask if I can keep it.

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: My wife and my daughter and the money. I'll bring the disks to the mall by the freeway, you bring my family.  We'll trade.

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: Fuck that!  You think I'm crazy?!

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I think you got no choice.

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: Fuck the mall.  You know that motel on the road west of town?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: You got ten minutes.  If you're one minute late, we won't be here to find.

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: Take it easy.  Just take it easy.  We're here to do business.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: You said they would be here, goddamnit! Where are they?

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: They're close.  Let me make a call.  You can see they're okay.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: You said they would be here!

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: You get the other one when I have my girls.  Not <u>talk</u> to them; <u>have</u> them.

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: Where is it?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Close.

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: All right.  Now the second one.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: First my girls.  I get my girls, you get the other disk.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I'll kill you!  You won't get the other disk!

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: If you shoot me, he'll kill your daughter.  Do you want to lose both of them?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I gave the other one to the Sheriffs and they're giving it to the <u>real</u> FBI.  This one's a fake.

turns.speaker: HOWELL
turns.text: You'd better be kidding.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I need to work out some stuff.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: You're hiding, Jeffrey.  You're hiding from the job and you're hiding from me.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I still see that boy's eyes.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Can we talk some more when you get here?

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: We'll see you in a couple of hours.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I should've called.  This thing broke right after we spoke, then everything happened so fast --

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Don't worry about it.  How are you doing?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: The Sheriffs will take over when they get here.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: But they're not here yet.  Tell me about <u>you</u>.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Why don't you guys grab some dinner at the Thai place?  I'll meet you there as soon as I can.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I don't know how long I'll be stuck here.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: I'm in no rush.  Maybe later we can talk.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I'm scared shitless.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: That's okay.  I love you anyway.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Ow!  Shit!

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Be quiet!  Listen!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: No one's coming.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: That big asshole nailed my windows.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Mine, too.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: We can use the crawlspace to get downstairs.  Then we can run for it.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: No!  I'm not going to leave Daddy with them!

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: We can't carry him.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You go, Thomas.  You get out, and I'll stay with Daddy.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: I'm not gonna leave you!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Go!  If you get out, maybe you can help the police!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You leave that gun alone!

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Shh, they'll hear you!

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Better than you getting killed!  Don't touch that gun!  Daddy says --

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: He can't reach us in here.  We're safe.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: MARS
turns.text: Want one?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I don't drink beer.

turns.speaker: MARS
turns.text: Mommy won't know.  You can do anything you want right now.  Mommy won't know.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: What I want is to help my father.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: MARS
turns.text: We can't make the microwave work.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MARS
turns.text: We're hungry.  You're going to cook.

turns.speaker: MARS
turns.text: Make the pizza.  I want scrambled eggs and hot dogs on mine.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: How about dog shit?

turns.speaker: MARS
turns.text: Kevin left without you.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You'd better get out of here!  Kevin's coming back!

turns.speaker: MARS
turns.text: Kevin's gone, your daddy's gone, everybody's gone.

turns.speaker: MARS
turns.text: Now we can do whatever we want.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Stop it.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Please get away from me.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Mars?  What are you doing?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: You gotta pee?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I don't see why you can't just lock me in.  It's not like I can go anywhere.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Either I'm going to tie you or Mars will tie you.  Which do you want?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Thanks for the shirt.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Whatever.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Kevin, my father needs a doctor.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: He's just knocked out.  I've been knocked out.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: If my father dies they'll charge you with his murder.  Can't you make Dennis see that?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Keep your voice down.  I'm taking you and your brother out of here.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Do you want to go or not?  I'm offering you a way out of here.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I can't go without Thomas.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: All three of us will go, but we have to move fast.  Mars and Dennis don't know I'm doing this.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: How can we get out?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Dennis and Mars are in the den.  I'll get your brother, then come back for you. We'll go down the stairs and out the front door, you understand?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Are civilians inside?

turns.speaker: JORGENSON
turns.text: He said something about a girl --

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Holster your guns!

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: We have to cordon off the streets, then evacuate these houses.

turns.speaker: JORGENSON
turns.text: What are we going to do about Mike?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Keep your head down.

turns.speaker: JORGENSON
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Get in the car.  <u>Now</u>.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I'm the chief of police here.  I have to talk to him.

turns.speaker: KLAUS
turns.text: Ain't gonna happen.  We've got unequal pupilation.  He could have an intracranial hematoma or a fracture or both.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Smith!  Wake up!

turns.speaker: KLAUS
turns.text: What are you doing?!  Stop that!

turns.speaker: KLAUS
turns.text: I'm not going to wake him.  I don't even know that I can.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Just one question.  Please.

turns.speaker: KLAUS
turns.text: He.  Can't.  Answer.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I'm Jeff Talley, the Bristo chief of police.  So far as we know, your children are okay.

turns.speaker: KLAUS
turns.text: Chief Talley is the one who got you out.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I need to talk to him.  Alone.

turns.speaker: KLAUS
turns.text: That's enough.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Another minute.  Please --

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: What are you talking about, shot?  What happened?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Three white males shot Junior.  Mike followed them to York Estates --

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Where are they?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: York Estates.  Four-five-five Castle Way. Anders and Jorgenson are on the way.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: That's not enough.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: What's that, Chief?  Say again.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Get everyone out here.  Then call the Sheriffs.  Tell them we have a possible hostage situation.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Is something wrong with Jane?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: We have a boy on the line.  He says he's Thomas Smith and he's calling from the house.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: It's a crank, Louise.  C'mon, don't waste my time with that!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: His cell number belongs to the Smiths.  I think it's real, Chief.  I think this boy is inside that house.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: One at a time!  Clear the air!  Louise?  Talk to me.  What do we have?

turns.speaker: LOUISE'S VOICE
turns.text: Junior Kim was DOA at the hospital.

turns.speaker: LOUISE'S VOICE
turns.text: Chief?  Mike said a young girl answered the door.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Did he say if she was shooting at him?

turns.speaker: LOUISE'S VOICE
turns.text: He didn't say.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Then we don't know if she's part of this or not.  Mickey, you up?

turns.speaker: LOUISE'S VOICE
turns.text: I pulled Mickey and Dreyer off the minimart.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Jesus Christ, Louise, we can't leave a crime scene like that.  Put a unit out there.

turns.speaker: LOUISE'S VOICE
turns.text: We only have eight officers on duty, Chief.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Louise?

turns.speaker: LOUISE'S VOICE
turns.text: Go, Chief.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Get a phone number for the Smiths.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Louise?

turns.speaker: LOUISE'S VOICE
turns.text: Go, Chief.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Call Jane for me.  She's at the little Thai place.

turns.speaker: LOUISE'S VOICE
turns.text: I know the one.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Tell her I'm almost home.

turns.speaker: LOUISE'S VOICE
turns.text: Chief, base.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Go.

turns.speaker: LOUISE'S VOICE
turns.text: I couldn't find Jane.  She wasn't at the restaurant.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: You have her cell number?

turns.speaker: LOUISE'S VOICE
turns.text: She didn't answer.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: They might be at the house.  Keep trying and let me know.  I'm going to be here a little while longer.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Did you find Jane and Mandy?

turns.speaker: LOUISE'S VOICE
turns.text: Could you call me back on your phone? Right away.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: What's wrong with the radio?

turns.speaker: LOUISE'S VOICE
turns.text: Other people can hear us.  Just call. <u>Please</u>.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Stand by.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I'm Talley.  Who's in charge?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Laura Martin.  This is Will Maddox, the primary negotiator --

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Do it.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Don't crowd the house.  The alpha's a kid named Rooney.  He's amped up and volatile.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Sounds like you know the job.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I've done it once or twice.  I blocked their phones to incoming calls, so you'll have to cut in a hard line to talk to him.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Maddox!  You got that?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Then get your men off the wall!  You breach that house, we're gonna have a bloodbath!  I <u>know</u> this guy, Captain -- I can talk to him.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Order your men to stand down.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: He says he has gasoline set to burn the place.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Jesus.  He must've siphoned it from the cars.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: If you go in, you can't use tear gas or flashbangs.  The whole place would go up.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Looks like you're bailing out at the right time.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: That's why you get the big bucks, Captain.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: He says that his father's hurt.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: If we have a man dying in there, we'll have to go in.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: They have security cameras.  Rooney would see you coming.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Did the boy say that any of them are in immediate danger?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: No.  He said that his father's unconscious; he didn't say he was dying.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Then I think we should wait.  Do you agree?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: You want me to stick around, I could --

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: You've been here all day, Chief.  Take a break.  See your family.  If I need you, I'll call.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Excuse me?  <u>You</u> requested our help.  You turned over command --

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: And now I'm taking it back.  We're getting Smith out of the house.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I want to know what in hell you're doing.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I'm looking for you.  I need your tactical unit.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I'm not stupid!  You can't get out of here fast enough, then you take back command; you agree to wait on Smith, then you risk everything in a stupid stunt to get him out --

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Don't question me, Captain!  This is <u>my</u> crime scene!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: -- then when you get him, you damn near assault the man in the ambulance!  <u>What</u> <u>is going on</u>?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Let it go, Captain.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Goddamned small town bullshit.

turns.speaker: MIKKELSON'S VOICE
turns.text: We're out two minutes, me and Dreyer.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Mike found a red pickup abandoned on Flanders.  You see it?

turns.speaker: MIKKELSON'S VOICE
turns.text: It's right in front of us.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Run a DMV on the plate for the owner's name.

turns.speaker: MIKKELSON'S VOICE
turns.text: Chief, Mikkelson.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Go, Mickey.

turns.speaker: MIKKELSON'S VOICE
turns.text: The truck is registered to Dennis James Rooney, white male, twenty-two.  He has an Agua Dulce address.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Contact the landlord.  I want to know employment, friends, family, anything we can find out about this guy.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: It's mine.  Talley.

turns.speaker: MIKKELSON'S VOICE
turns.text: Chief, it's Mikkelson.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Go, Mickey.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Mickey?  Call the state Homicide Bureau. Don't touch anything, just sit back and wait.

turns.speaker: MIKKELSON'S VOICE
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: Okay, here's mine.  My name is Special Agent Jones.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Are all of you named Jones?

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: Don't be funny, Chief.  You can't afford it.

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: In a few minutes the white phone is going to ring.  So let's get our shit straight before that happens.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: You used to be a cop.  All of you used to be cops.  I can tell by the way you move.

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: Don't worry about what we used to be.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: How do you people expect this to work? The Sheriffs have a Crisis Response Team here.

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: What's my name?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: I asked you my name.  You just saw my commission slip.  What's my fucking name?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Special Agent Jones.

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: Think of me that way and you won't fuck up.  I'll handle the Sheriffs.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: What are you people going to do?

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: You and I are gonna straighten this out with the Sheriffs, and then we'll wait for the man to call.  When he gives the word, we move.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: What does he have on you?  I know why I'm doing this, but what does he have on you?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: We've got to get those kids out of there!

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: Not until the man calls.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Those kids are in there with a fucking psychopath!  He <u>kills</u> people!

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: They've been in there all day.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: The kids are in here!

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: Where's the office?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Help me, goddamnit, we can get the disks later!

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: This is Chief Talley.  Tell me your name, son.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Thomas Smith.  I'm in the house that's on TV.  Dennis hit my dad and now he won't wake up.  You gotta help him.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Slow down, Thomas.  Take it easy and talk to me.  Was your father shot?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Dennis hit him.  His head's all big and he won't wake up.  I'm really scared.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: How about you and your sister?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: We're okay.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Where are you right now?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: In my room.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: That's on the second floor.  Could you climb out your window if we were downstairs to catch you?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: They nailed the windows.  I can't get'm open.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I've got the boy on the phone.  He's using a cell phone.  What was that, son?  I didn't hear you.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: If I try to climb out they'll see me on the security cameras.  They would see you outside, too --

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Is my daddy okay?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: The doctors are taking care of him right now.  Thomas . . . are you safe?  Can you talk?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: I think so.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I need your help with something.  But if you think those guys could catch you, then I don't want you to do it, okay?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I'm serious, Thomas; I don't want you to get hurt.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: What do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Your dad has two computer disks.  They have funny names:  Marlon and Al.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: He has lots of disks.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I think he was working on them today, so they're probably in his office.  Could you find them and see who they belong to?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Dennis won't let me go to the desk.  He makes me sit on the floor.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: But I might be able to sneak into the office if they're not around.  Then I could open the disks here in my room.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I thought they locked you in your room.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: I can get into the crawlspace from my closet and climb all over the house.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Can you get into the office?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: I can get into the den.  The office is right across the hall.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: If I get Rooney into the back of the house, can you find the disks without being caught?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Can you open them?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: I opened Marlon.  I think it's somebody's taxes.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Look for names.  Does it say whose taxes they are?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: I don't see any people names.  It's all businesses.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Try Al.  See if you can open Al.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Yeah!  Here's a name.  This is somebody's personal tax --

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Charles G. Benza.  They're coming!

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Are the disks still in your room?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: No!  They're right here --
